meaningMnemonic:
If you remember 重ねる, then you'll recognize this as the intransitive version of that verb. Literally, this means <vocabulary>to be piled up</vocabulary>, but it's often used to mean <vocabulary>to coincide</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to overlap</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to accumulate</vocabulary>.

As is often our recommendation for more complicated or hard-to-translate words like this one, check out our common word combinations and context sentences to see how this word is used!
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You learned that reading with 重ねる, but in case it's slipped your mind, here's a mnemonic to help you remember:

All these boxes that are <vocabulary>piled up</vocabulary> are here because you've just moved into your new <reading>casa</reading> (かさ). Congratulations! Now it's time to unpack every single box you've <vocabulary>accumulate</vocabulary>d. Have fun.
